newsitem.title: USA: Minuteman says outlook strong for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Minuteman says outlook strong for 1997.

text.p: Minuteman International Inc, which reported lower first quarter earnings, said its outlook for the remainder of 1997 remains strong.

"The outlook for the remainder of the year appears to be strong, despite continuing investments in our long-term strategies, as we introduce additional products and further expand into international markets," Jerome Rau, president, said in a statement.

Minuteman, which makes commercial and industrial vacuums, floor and carpet care equipment, and cleaning and coating products, reported first quarter net income of $0.21 a share. A year ago it earned $0.30 a share after an $0.08 gain from the sale of a former manufacturing facility.

Operating profits were down 7.2 percent due in part to costs associated with promotional efforts, investments to establish its Multi-Clean line of chemical cleaning products as a separate division, and by absorbing some supplier price increases and higher group insurance premiums.

Sales rose 9.8 percent to a record $14.1 million in the quarter, from $12.8 milllion a year ago. Minuteman said demand was particularly strong in North America, aided by promotions that were aimed at capturing additional market share.
